The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, they do not realize that what was going on with them is solely linked to an unseen and ancient force: The half-African/British brothers living near to where the mining operation occurs explain to them their preacher detained, originated from another sect of their faith once abducted by some immensely terrible sand biking elephants poaching trade .

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back and reminds me of your childhood and some incredible work by its writers, technicians and directors.
The story starts with an opening scene monologue whose translator “Yōsuke Matsuzaki” made a very good job on (the original japanese version’s being severely repetitive).

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures across the Universe in their space ships flying overhead with their telescopic eyes spying on us dish-washed creatures. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the success of The Last Dragon ; It borrows many of it’s visual elements and has a very similar feel without any apparent story influence. Despite it’s obvious rip-off nature, Revenge Of The Ninja is still enjoyable; Well made with a visually creative score
